column4: Anyone know what repository I need to use to get Google's Picasa through Synaptic?
I just figure it would be a lot easier to manage through synaptic than to just install manually... y'know?
weird man... I just entered "deb http://dl.google.com/linux/deb/ stable non-free" into the apt line and hit "reload" and the app just disappeared (i.e. crashed ... I think)
did you do it from the command line?
You've got to understand, I'm like REALLY really new at this... I hit the "custom" button and there's a field you can enter it into.  That's where I entered it.
I guess I can just as easily do it through the terminal huh?
have you ever edited a text file on windows?...

I'm in the file now (sudo -s asked for a pw, and I"m not logged in as root... I just hit enter and it brought me back to the prompt... that's okay?)... btw, I'm a noob at Linux (have a bit of knowledge, but just a bit) but I'm not a noob overall..
heh, the line is in the file already... I guess it added it before it bombed...
you are the sudo user if you are first user on system
your password you use for the sudo user in other words
you have to sudo apt-get update...
sh*t! I just found what bombed it... I previously entered only the URL and not "deb ..." so it just breaks when it hits that line
